subject: Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: The United States lost to Switzerland, 5-2, in its final warm-up before the World Championships in Kloten, Switzerland. The 16-nation tournament begins Friday. The United States opens play Saturday against Latvia in Group C, which also includes Sweden and Austria. The Americans adapted well in the first period to the larger rink used in international play, taking a 2-0 lead on a two-man advantage and while short-handed. But the undermanned American team, which has practiced once since landing in Europe, dressed only 18 players compared with 23 for the Swiss.
